page.title: 06ECOLOGY:FISHING:FLEET
page.content: THE{CHESIL}IS ONE OF THE BEST{FISHING GROUNDS IN{ENGLAND}.IT IS FAMOUS FOR ITS SEINE{FISHING}WITH WHICH THEY CATCH HUNDREDS OF{MACKEREL}.SEINE{ {FISHING}IS WHEN YOU GO WITH A BOAT AND DROP A NET,AND MEN ON THE SHORE PULL IT IN WITH ROPES.THE{BAIT}FOR{MACKEREL IS A FEATHERED TRACE OR LURES.YOU CAN ALSO CATCH{COD,WHITING, GUARNARD, {FLAT-FISH, HERRING, POLLOCK, GARFISH, {SPRATS}AND{HORSE-MACKEREL}.THE{BAIT} FOR ALOT OF THEM IS{WORM}.SOME OF THE {FISH}THERE ARE ENORMOUS LIKE{COD. { }IN{SPRING}SPRATS TURN UP ON THE{ {SHORE}IN TONS.SOME{FISH}ARE CAUGHT AT THIRTY METRES NET.{MACKEREL}COME IN THEIR HUNDREDS VERY CLOSE TO THE{ {SHORE.}IN THE SUMMER HOLIDAYS HUNDREDS OF VISITORS SPEND DAYS OF THEIR HOLIDAYS{FISHING}ON THE BEACH FOR{MACKEREL}.
